thread.section_title: Gary Neville urges Jose Mourinho to offer Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal – Metro
thread.title: Gary Neville urges Jose Mourinho to offer Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal
thread.title_full: Gary Neville urges Jose Mourinho to offer Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal

author: louissealey1
title: Gary Neville urges Jose Mourinho to offer Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic two-year deal
text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic signed a one-year deal at Manchester United last summer (Picture: Getty) Gary Neville has urged Jose Mourinho to offer experienced Manchester United striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic a new two-year deal at Old Trafford.
Ibrahimovic ended a four-year spell at Paris Saint-Germain last summer when he signed a one-year contract with the Red Devils.
Arsene Wenger speaks out on Barcelona's interest in Hector Bellerin Despite the move being questioned by some, Ibrahimovic has proved a hit in the Premier League, scoring 15 goals in 25 games.
The Swedish veteran is believed to have a clause in his contract, ensuring he will remain at United for at least another year.
And club legend Neville believes it is imperative for Mourinho to secure Ibrahimovic’ services on a two-year deal.
When asked whether he would hand the forward a new deal, Neville told Omnisport : ‘I’d say yes – because of the professionalism, the training and his commitment to the club.
‘I think United needed personalities and characters after what happened in the previous few seasons. A lot of United’s success has revolved around him.’
Former Manchester United and England defender Gary Neville (Picture: Getty) While former England defender Neville hopes to see Ibrahimovic stay at the Theatre of Dreams, he ackowkledged that the striker may be forced to adopt a more limited role because of his age.
‘What I would say is, it will be impossible for him to play every single match in that period,’ Neville added.
Red Devils boss Jose Mourinho (Picture: Getty) More: Football Mbappe & the four Monaco stars Chelsea, Man Utd and Arsenal should be fighting to sign 
Wenger reveals why he was happy to avoid Chelsea & Spurs in FA Cup semi-final 
Antonio Conte unhappy with Chelsea's board and has ordered them to make a major change 
‘There has to be a dip at some point. Ultimately, it’s how Mourinho manages him over a two-year period because he wants to play every match.
‘The reality is, I’m not quite sure that will be able to happen as he continues to get a little bit older.’
